description.narrative: MOE har ansökt om finansiering från SIDA på 4 miljoner SEK i syfte att genomföra programmet ”Demokratiskt Medborgarskap för Fred” i Colombia under perioden 1 juli 2015 till 30 juni 2016. Programmet syftar till att stärka den colombianska demokratin genom organiserat, informerat och aktivt medborgarskap genom 1) att producera relevant, tillförlitlig och tidsmässigt läglig information för allmänheten kring politisk dynamik inför, under och efter valen, 2) förbättra medias metodologi i samband med täckningen av de colombianska val- och politiska processer inom fredsförhandlingarna; 3) påverka utformningen och genomförandet av policies för valprocessen och 4) att utföra oberoende valobservation för lokalvalen som äger rum i oktober 2015. De fyra tänkta resultaten förväntas tillsammans att bidra till stärkandet av det demokratiska systemet och öka deltagandet och transparensen i valprocesser. Projektet är en del av MOE:s strategiska plan för 2013-2015. Projektets totala budget för ett år är 2.800.000.000 COP (1,5 miljoner USD eller 10 miljoner SEK) där Sverige bidrar med nästan 40%, ca 550.000 USD (4 miljoner SEK). De resterande 6 miljoner SEK bidrar USAID med genom ett redan undertecknat avtal.

The Electoral Observation Mission (MOE) has applied for Sida funding of 4 million SEK to carry out the “Democratic Citizenship for peace programme” in Colombia during the period July 1st 2015 to June 30, 2016. The intervention aims at strengthening Colombian democracy through an organized, informed and active citizenship by 1) producing timely and reliable information about political and electoral issues; 2) improving media methodologies to cover the Colombian electoral and political processes in a context of peace negotiations; 3) influencing the definition and implementation of public policies for citizen’s participation and 4) making an independent electoral observation of the elections that will be held in October 2015. The four intended outputs together contribute to strengthen democratic system as increase participation and transparency in the electoral process. This contribution is a grant for core support to MOE’s strategic plan 2013-2015. The intervention’s total budget for one year is 2.800.000.000 Colombian Pesos (1,5 million US Dollars or 10 million SEK) of which Sweden is contributing with almost 40%, approximately 550.000US dollars (4 MSEK). The remaining 6 MSEK is contributed by USAID within an already signed agreement.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The Electoral Observation Mission (MOE) has achieved the intended outcome of contributing to a democracy strengthened by citizens who know and exercise their political and electoral rights in an informed, active, responsible, and tolerant way to new scenarios of political inclusion. In 2016, for 8 municipalities that went through atypical electoral processes, 46 observers were deployed. For the plebiscite for the endorsement of the peace agreements, 2465 observers were deployed in 430 municipalities. MOE produced reliable information for authorities, media and citizens, such as electoral risk maps, regional monographs, and public media campaigns to prevent electoral crimes and incentive citizens’ complaints. MOE worked within a specific context: the peace process between the National Government and the FARC. From this, a series of institutional reforms to the electoral system came, seeking the consolidation of territorial democracy. At the same time, efforts were made to strengthen civil society in the urban context. In the same way, the political participation of women in Colombia was strengthened through the principles of parity, alternation, and universality through a bill promoted at Congress.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
